result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Brian James Hunt in court.  Attorney Brian Michael Borkowicz in court for Brian James Hunt.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. victim present.  Counsel req adj to allow counsel to review discovery w/def.  Def req bond modification.  Court questions victim.  Court amends condition of bond.

Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Hearing on September 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with MMD, JMH, except a one time visit for 20 minutes to obtain personal belongings in the presence of law enforcement officer.  Not be in any establishment whose primary function is sale/serving of alcohol.

Defendant Brian James Hunt in court, in custody.  Attorney Gillion Parham in court for Brian James Hunt.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Does not qualify for SPD requesting court appointed attorney. Court appoints Atty Borkowicz.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $200 per month commencing 9/15/22. Court sets $500 cash bond. Not guilty pleas entered by Court.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
